segment.source: Lab 1f: Build a retail image
segment.target: Lab 1f: Build a retail image

segment.source: Lab 1f: Build a retail image
segment.target: Lab 1f: Build a retail image

segment.source: This content has been tested on Windows 10 IoT Core Build 10586.
segment.target: This content has been tested on Windows 10 IoT Core Build 10586.

segment.source: Some of these procedures do not yet work on newer preview builds, including Windows 10, version 1607.
segment.target: Some of these procedures do not yet work on newer preview builds, including Windows 10, version 1607.

segment.source: We''ll take our test image and convert it to a retail build.
segment.target: We''ll take our test image and convert it to a retail build.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: We'll start with the ProjectA image we created from Lab 1a: Create a basic image.
segment.target: We'll start with the ProjectA image we created from Lab 1a: Create a basic image.

segment.source: You can include any of the updates from Lab 1b: Add an app to your image, Lab 1c: Add a file and a registry setting to an image, Lab 1d: Add a provisioning package to an image, and Lab 1e: Add a driver to an image.
segment.target: You can include any of the updates from Lab 1b: Add an app to your image, Lab 1c: Add a file and a registry setting to an image, Lab 1d: Add a provisioning package to an image, and Lab 1e: Add a driver to an image.

segment.source: Add your app to the retail configuration file
segment.target: Add your app to the retail configuration file

segment.source: Open your product's retail configuration file: C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-archProductsProductARetailOEMInput.xml..
segment.target: Open your product's retail configuration file: C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-archProductsProductARetailOEMInput.xml..

segment.source: Add your feature manifest, OEMFM.xml, into the list of AdditionalFMs.
segment.target: Add your feature manifest, OEMFM.xml, into the list of AdditionalFMs.

segment.source: At the same time, add the feature manifest: OEMCommonFM.xml, which contains the OEMCustomCmd package that configures your app on the first boot:
segment.target: At the same time, add the feature manifest: OEMCommonFM.xml, which contains the OEMCustomCmd package that configures your app on the first boot:

segment.source: Add the FeatureIDs for the your app package, the and the OEMCustomCmd package.
segment.target: Add the FeatureIDs for the your app package, the and the OEMCustomCmd package.

segment.source: OEM_CustomCmd is required to trigger the app installation.
segment.target: OEM_CustomCmd is required to trigger the app installation.

segment.source: OEM_ProvAuto is required to pull in the provisioning package.
segment.target: OEM_ProvAuto is required to pull in the provisioning package.

segment.source: OEM_FileAndRegKey, OEM_AppxHelloWorld, and OEM_DriverHelloBlinky were sample packages added in previous labs.
segment.target: OEM_FileAndRegKey, OEM_AppxHelloWorld, and OEM_DriverHelloBlinky were sample packages added in previous labs.

segment.source: To support your apps, add the FeatureIDs for IOT_UAP_OOBE and IOT_APP_TOOLKIT from the main list of Microsoft features:
segment.target: To support your apps, add the FeatureIDs for IOT_UAP_OOBE and IOT_APP_TOOLKIT from the main list of Microsoft features:

segment.source: Build and create the image
segment.target: Build and create the image

segment.source: Build the image
segment.target: Build the image

segment.source: From the IoT Core Shell, create the image:
segment.target: From the IoT Core Shell, create the image:

segment.source: This creates the product binaries at C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitBuildarchProductARetailFlash.FFU.
segment.target: This creates the product binaries at C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitBuildarchProductARetailFlash.FFU.

segment.source: Start Windows IoT Core DashboardSetup a new deviceCustom, and browse to your image.
segment.target: Start Windows IoT Core DashboardSetup a new deviceCustom, and browse to your image.

segment.source: Put the Micro SD card in the device, select it, accept the license terms, and click Install.
segment.target: Put the Micro SD card in the device, select it, accept the license terms, and click Install.

segment.source: This replaces the previous image with our new image.
segment.target: This replaces the previous image with our new image.

segment.source: Put the card into the IoT device and start it up.
segment.target: Put the card into the IoT device and start it up.

segment.source: After a short while, the device should start automatically, and you should see your app.
segment.target: After a short while, the device should start automatically, and you should see your app.

segment.source: Check to see if everything is working
segment.target: Check to see if everything is working

segment.source: With retail builds, you won't be able to log into the device using the SSH clients or by using the web interface.
segment.target: With retail builds, you won't be able to log into the device using the SSH clients or by using the web interface.

segment.source: However, any files and reg keys that your app relies on should still work.
segment.target: However, any files and reg keys that your app relies on should still work.

segment.source: Next steps
segment.target: Next steps

segment.source: Congratulations!
segment.target: Congratulations!

segment.source: That's it for the first lab.
segment.target: That's it for the first lab.

segment.source: From here, you can continue on to:
segment.target: From here, you can continue on to:

segment.source: Lab 2a: Replace a driver in an existing board support package
segment.target: Lab 2a: Replace a driver in an existing board support package
